HomeAlone.business

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • HomeAlone.business.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Main class for the game. This class contains all the methods for initialising the game as well as the methods called by the presentation layer. It is using the singleton pattern.

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Game getInstance()
        Method used to get access to the Game object.
        Returns:
        Game object

      • restart

        public static void restart()
        Method called in case the player wishes to restart the game. It deletes the connection to the Game object so a new have to be created.

      • getPhase

        public int getPhase()
        Getter method for the attribute phase
        Returns:
        phase

      • changePhase

        public int changePhase()
        Changes the phase and checks certain conditions for losing the game. This method is used to change the phases during gameplay, including writing new objectives. When it changes the phases, it checks the conditions are met for the next phase, and changes the attribute status if needed as well as writing a reason for losing or winning. Part of the "interface" to the presentaion layer.
        Returns:
        phase

      • inKitchenWithGun

        public boolean inKitchenWithGun()
        Called during second phase to force a phase shift if player is fast. This method is used in phase 2 to check if the player gets to the kitchen before the 1 minute timer runs out. If that happens the method returns true and the game changes to phase 3 instead of having to wait out the timer. Part of the "interface" to the presentation layer.
        Returns:
        true if Player is in the kitchen with the BB-gun, false if not

      • checkNeighbourRoom

        public java.lang.String checkNeighbourRoom()
        Checks the rooms around the players room for "the wet bandits". This method is used in phase 3 to check if the 2 Nonplayer objects are located in one of the rooms next to the Room the Player is currently in. If it finds a Nonplayer in any of the neighbouring rooms, it returns a string indicating that the Room is occupied. If it finds more than one, both rooms are added to the string. Part of the "interface" to the presentation layer.
        Returns:
        empty string if neighbouring rooms are empty, warning if not

      • checkForKevin

        public void checkForKevin(Nonplayer npc)
        Checks to see if Player is in the same room as any of "the wet bandits". This method is used during phase 3 to check if Player is in the same Room as any of "the wet bandits" and if the Nonplayer in question does not have a delay the game is lost. If the Nonplayer does have a delay, Player is free to move through the room.
        Parameters:
        npc - Nonplayer object

      • checkStatus

        public boolean checkStatus()
        Checks the status of the game. This method checks the attribute status to see if the game is lost. The default setting is that the game is won, so this method just checks to see if the status is changed to lose in which case it returns false else it will return true. Part of the "interface" to the presentation layer.
        Returns:
        false is game is lost, true if it is not

      • getCurrentRoomItems

        public java.lang.String getCurrentRoomItems()
        Left over from the CLI version of the game, before we split the code up in layers
        Returns:
        string of item names in a room

      • setZipline

        public boolean setZipline(java.lang.String item)
        Sets up the zipline escape route and moves the player to Treehouse. This method is used in phase 1 to set up the zipline from Attic to Treehouse. It takes a string with the item name, then checks its the right Item calls setTrap(String trapName) and moves the Player to the Treehouse using the method Creature.setCurrentRoom(HomeAlone.business.Room). Part of the "interface" to the presentation layer.
        Parameters:
        item - String
        Returns:
        true if the zipline is set up, false if en error occurred

      • goRoom

        public boolean goRoom(java.lang.String command)
        Intermediary between presentation layer and Player. This method is called from the presentation layer to move the player to a different room. After checking the various conditions on the phases, it calls the method in Player that moves the player to a new room. Part of the "interface" to the presentation layer.
        Parameters:
        command - String
        Returns:
        true if successful, false if not

      • getFinished

        public boolean getFinished()
        Getter method for attribute finished Part of the "interface" to the presentation layer.
        Returns:
        finished, boolean value

      • getCurrentRoomLongDescription

        public java.lang.String getCurrentRoomLongDescription()
        Left over from CLI
        Returns:
        String containing the long description of a room.

      • pickupItem

        public boolean pickupItem(java.lang.String command)
        Intermediary between presentation layer and Player. This method is called by the presentation layer, to pickup an item from the room the player is currently in. Calls the methods checkForKevin(Nonplayer npc) and walkPath(Nonplayer npc) during phase 3. Returns true if the item is picked up and false if it is not. Part of the "interface" to the presentation layer.
        Parameters:
        command - String
        Returns:
        true if successful, false if not

      • getError

        public java.lang.String getError(java.lang.String e)
        Intermediary between presentation layer and Creature. This method returns a string if an error occured when using these methods: Player.pickupItem(java.lang.String) Player.placeTrap(java.lang.String) Player.dropCommand(java.lang.String) Part of the "interface" to the presentation layer.
        Parameters:
        e - String
        Returns:
        empty string if no errors found, or a string containing the error

      • getCurrentRoomShortDescription

        public java.lang.String getCurrentRoomShortDescription()
        Returns the short description to the presentation layer. This method is used to return the short description of the current room to the presentation layer. Part of the "interface" to the presentation layer.
        Returns:
        string containing room description

      • getCurrentRoomInfo

        public java.lang.String getCurrentRoomInfo()
        Intermediary between presentation layer and Room. This method returns the information for the current room. Part of the "interface" to the presentation layer.
        Returns:
        string containing information about a room, if game is lost

      • setTrap

        public boolean setTrap(java.lang.String trapName)
        Intermediary between presentation layer and Player This method checks status using checkStatus(), calls the methods checkForKevin(Nonplayer npc) and walkPath(Nonplayer npc) for both Nonplayer oblects and then calls the method Player.placeTrap(java.lang.String). Part of the "interface" to the presentation layer.
        Parameters:
        trapName - String
        Returns:
        true if successful, false if not

      • getItemString

        public java.lang.String getItemString(java.lang.String command)
        Left over from CLI
        Parameters:
        command - String
        Returns:
        epmty string if no items found, else a string with list of items

      • getTrapString

        public java.lang.String getTrapString()
        Intermediary between presentation layer and Room. This method is used to get a list of the possible traps for the room the player is currently in. This is done by calling Room.getTrapString(). Part of the "interface" to the presentation layer.
        Returns:
        empty string or list of traps as string

      • getTrapInfo

        public java.lang.String getTrapInfo()
        Intermediay between presentation layer and Room. This method returns the traps that have been set in a room. Part of the "interface" to the presentation layer.
        Returns:
        string containing traps set or empty string if no traps are set

      • dropItem

        public boolean dropItem(java.lang.String itemName)
        Intermediary between presentation layer and Player. This method calls the method Player.dropCommand(java.lang.String). Part of the "interface" to the presentation layer.
        Parameters:
        itemName - String
        Returns:
        true if successful, false if not

      • getExitsObservableList

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList getExitsObservableList()
        Intermediary between presentation layer and Room. This method return an ObservableList with the available exits from the players current room. This is done by calling Room.getExitString() and splitting the returned string in to a String array, iterate through the array and adding each exit to the ObservableList. Part of the "interface" to the presentation layer.
        Returns:
        an ObservableList with available exits as strings

      • getItemsObservableList

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList getItemsObservableList()
        Intermediary between presentation layer and Room. This method returns an ObservableList with the available items in the players current room. This is done by calling Room.getItems() and splitting the returned string in to a String array, iterate through the array and adding each item name to the ObservableList. Part of the "interface" to the presentation layer.
        Returns:
        an ObservableList with available item names

      • getInventoryObservableList

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList getInventoryObservableList()
        Intermediary between presentation layer and Player. This method returns an ObservableList with the items the player has picked up. This is done by calling Player.getInventory() and splitting the returned string in to a String array, iterate through the array and adding each item name to the ObservableList. Part of the "interface" to the presentation layer.
        Returns:
        an ObservableList with item names the player has picked up

      • printHelp

        public java.lang.String printHelp()
        Left over from CLI
        Returns:
        string with the available exits or empty string

      • quit

        public boolean quit()
        Left over from CLI
        Returns:
        true

      • show

        public java.lang.String show(java.lang.String command)
        left over from CLI
        Parameters:
        command - String
        Returns:
        String containing either the inventory or objective

      • getObjective

        public java.lang.String getObjective()
        Returns the objective to be displayed in presentation layer. This method returns objective for the players current phase. Part of the "interface" to the presentation layer.
        Returns:
        string containing the objective for a phase

      • getResult

        public java.lang.String getResult()
        Returns the result of the players effort. This method is called when the game is over and the end screen is shown. Part of the "interface" to the presentation layer.
        Returns:
        string indication win or lose

      • isPhoneHere

        public boolean isPhoneHere()
        Checks if the item Phone is in the room. This method is used in phase 3 to check if the phone is in the same room as the player.
        Returns:
        true if the phone is present, false if it is not

      • getResultReason

        public java.lang.String getResultReason()
        Getter method for the attribute resultReason. This method is using in the end screen to give a reason for the player winning or losing the game. Part of the "interface" to the presentation layer.
        Returns:
        String

      • getRoomObject

        public Room getRoomObject(int index)
        Unused code, should be deleted
        Parameters:
        index - int
        Returns:
        Room object
